p: Viral NP is a major target of MxA and the adaptive mutations of NP enable the virus to escape from MxA restriction [ 20, 21, 41]. Analysis of a total of 153 representative nucleotide sequences of viral NPs from IAVs with different host specificities (including avian, swine, canine, equine, and human) showed that the NP proteins generate diverse lineages in a host-species-specific manner ( Figure 2). Considering the diversity of Mx1 proteins and the different activities on viruses from different hosts ( Figure 1), we hypothesized that the NP from equine viruses may have evolved a specific signature of adaptation to counter eqMx1, and this “signature” of the equine virus may not be able to overcome the restriction of human MxA.
